section.name: The task definition
section.p: Tasks will be defined in the config.xml of your OCTOPUS module, e.g. under src/main/webapp/OCTOPUS/config.xml in your OCTOPUS webapplication. Decisive is the tcModuleConfig.tasks section.

section.name: Response tag and parameters
section.p: A response tag in your task defines the end of the task. It expect the two attributes type and name.
The following response types are available:

tr.td: The TcRawResponseEngine transfer a plain string.
The TcSimpleResponseEngine use an alternative template engine.
The TcSoapResponseEngine use SOAP to transfer data.
The TcVelocityResponseEngine use velocity as template engine.
The TcXmlrpcResponseEngine use XML-RPC to transfer data.
The TcXsltResponseEngine use XSLT to transfer the data in every other format.

section.p: The response tag can contain additional parameters:
Some response parameters will be allowed in every response type and some will only be supported by special response engines. (no support for direct connect):

tr.td: MimeType, e.g. text/html;charset=UTF-8. If not present, the ContentType will be used from the module-wide or server-wide parameter defaultContentType.
The used encoding for the writer, e.g. UTF-8. If not present, the encoding will be used from the module-wide or server-wide parameter defaultEncoding.
Time in milliseconds, default is zero (no caching allowed).
Comma seperated parameter without spaces. Allowed parameter are:

nocachecontrol disable the Cache-Control-Header in the HTTP-Response.
Note: Use this in your all your "download tasks", this fix some problems with the MSIE 6 which was specified in KB 812935 and KB 316431.

nopragma disable the Pragma-Header in the HTTP-Response.
Note: Use this in your all your "download tasks", this fix some problems with the MSIE 6 which was specified in KB 812935 and KB 316431.

section.name: Response engine "binary"
section.p: This response engine use the name attribute of the task tag for getting the "response object". It can handle different types of objects:

tr.td: Handle the string as filename and pipe the file.
Pipe this file as stream to the response.
Pipe this inputstream to the response.
Pipe this reader to the response.
This map contain different keys with parameters, please watch the java doc.

section.name: Response engine "velocity"
section.p: This response engine use the name attribute of the task tag + the extension .vm for the filename and parse this velocity file with the whole OCTOPUS content.
